intro: Mentzelia pinnatifida, commonly known as the desert bluebells, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has opposite, narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Mentzelia pinnatifida is an important species for pollinators and is considered a member of the Loasaceae family.
